newsitem.title: UK: Celltech advances on new drug hopes.
newsitem.headline: Celltech advances on new drug hopes.

text.p: Shares in biotechnology company Celltech Plc rose as a report that German partner Bayer AG said a drug still under test will be launched next year, percolated through the market.
"This is wishful thinking," said one analyst.

"The result is more likely to come this autumn so although it's potentially good news, what Bayer said doesn't bear on whether the trial is going to be successful, although it looks as though it's been taken as meaning that," he said.
The drug, codenamed BAYX 1351 at Celltech and called Norasept at Bayer, is a treatment for septic shock, the Financial Times said on Thursday.
The drug had been in clinical trials for several years and the results of the final large-scale trial had been planned for the end of this month, the paper said.
Analysts forecast Celltech's share price could rise above 750p if the trial was successful. Celltech put on 10p to 575p in early trading.
